result.execSummary:
The defendant Dajuann D Bogan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.
Concurrent with: with time now serving.

superMiscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Zimmerman Consulting Inc (ZCI) testing and monitoring fees.
Complete high school education.  Obtain full-time employment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Attend community re-entry program upon release.  Enroll in counseling through Racine Vocational Ministry.  Comply with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate, including cognitive thinking program.  No contact with co-actors.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.
Restitution to be determined at hearing scheduled for August 9, 2016.  AMENDED 8/9/16:  RESTITUTION IS SET AT ZERO

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victims, SM, ROB and SR (person, property, residence or family).   Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.   No contact with victim store, High Street Food Mart, except for restitution purposes.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 6/3/2016 Defendant to be placed on house arrest with GPS monitoring through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Must reside at 1611 Grand Avenue. May attend court, meetings with his attorney, church on Sunday with his mother. Not allowed to have anyone at the house unless approved by his mother. Not allowed to post any information about the case on social media.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.
